oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bells Chapel Baptist: side view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of church front and side view. The two-story building contains a rear addition. Five bays of windows line the side and two bays of six-over-six windows line the addition's facade. The church marquee sign and bell sit to the front right of the church.

Established on April 4, 1881, Bells Chapel Baptist Church is a rural African American church in Bells, Tennessee. The church was rebuilt in 1949. According to the fieldnotes, it was an "outstanding, intact 1949 church in extremely poor African-American neighborhood." Since the completion of fieldwork, the building has underwent remodeling.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Baptist church buildings
